column2: ebservice deployment with undertow application security domain fals
The application-security-domain resources do not need to add a JACC service dependency so do not require the JACC capability.
Combine SecurityDomain resolution with capability refactoring under WFLY-13433.
The layer which brings in the security-manager subsystem is called "security-manager".
Adjust EJB deployment to make use of pre-defined security domain and advertise the name of any security domain selected during the EJB deployment process.
Support for multiple security realms - Failover
Revert "[WFLY-13648] Temporarily mark 'org.jboss.as.security-integration` as an unreferenced module."
Temporarily mark 'org.jboss.as.security-integration` as an unreferenced module.
Only install JACC specific DeploymentUnitProcessors / Services if one of the security subsystems is initialising JACC.
Register the 'org.wildfly.legacy-security.jacc' capability if JACC is being initialised.
Don't skip Web JACC permissions without the legacy security subsystem as Elytron may still be available.
Move the EarSecurityDeployer and related utility classes into the EE subsystem as it is no longer specific to the security subsystem.
Processing of JACC for a deploment should not just consider the legacy security subsystem as Elytron may be installed.
Make 'org.jboss.security.auth.message.config.JBossAuthConfigFactory' available to dependents of this module.
Create a new 'security-integration' module which will contain a service descritptor for PolicyContextHandler.
Also expose SecurityDomain from ApplicationSecurityDomain so we can re-use it.
Convert the ApplicationSecurityDomain resource to use the new MSC APIs.
Re-advertise the SecurityDomain as an alias to the ApplicationSecurityDomain service so a ServiceName can be advertised.
Move security domain name resolution before UndertowDeploymentProcessor.

WFSM000001: Permission check failed ... FilePermission when Security Manager enabled and Web App tries to forward to jsp
EJB Client authentication does not work using SASL DIGEST-MD5 and EXTERNAL mechanisms in Legacy security - test
At EJB3 remote AssociationImpl we need to take into account the possibility of identity being null before setting up connection in SecurityActions.
